jobs.title: Engineering Manager (Growth)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

Scribe is where exceptional people come to do the best work of their careers. More than 94% of the Fortune 500 use Scribe to ensure work gets done right. Our Workflow AI platform automatically documents and optimizes workflows so teams work smarter, faster, and more consistently.

We’re growing fast — since our founding in 2019, we’ve grown to over 5 million users across 600,000 businesses. Based in San Francisco, we've raised $55M in funding from top-tier investors and are honored to have been named as a Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup and LinkedIn Top Startup. Join us in our mission to uplevel how people do work.

How we work

We are builders aspiring to master our crafts. We care deeply about our teammates and want to win, together. We embrace the following values:

  • Accelerate impact

  • Raise the bar

  • Make our users heroes

  • Clear is kind

  • Rapid learning machine

  • One team one dream

About the Role

We’re looking for a Growth Engineering Manager to lead a high-impact team responsible for driving Scribe’s core product growth metrics, including activation, conversion, and retention. In this role, you’ll oversee the planning, building, and delivery of growth experiments, onboarding flows, and in-product self-service billing. You’ll work closely with cross-functional partners in Product, Design, Marketing, and Engineering leadership to execute on a growth roadmap that directly impacts Scribe’s bottom line. This role reports to our Head of Engineering and is based in San Francisco, CA.

What you’ll do

  • Lead and grow a team of 5+ engineers, providing day-to-day management, coaching, and career development.

  • Drive velocity of growth experimentation and own key systems like onboarding and self-service billing flows.

  • Partner with Product, Design, and Marketing to align growth initiatives and deliver measurable impact.

  • Establish an experimentation culture: set up, run, and analyze A/B tests that directly influence activation, conversion, and retention.

  • Build scalable operating models as the team expands, potentially growing into oversight of multiple subteams (e.g., billing and growth).

You could be a great fit if

You’re excited by the idea of building a “growth lab” inside a hypergrowth company. You believe in experimentation as the engine of learning and impact, and you thrive on helping engineers become independent “growth scientists” who can take an idea from concept to shipped experiment. You’ll find this role rewarding if you enjoy working cross-functionally, want to leave your fingerprints on core company metrics, and care about leading with kindness while pushing for high performance.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience leading engineering teams, ideally in a high-growth SaaS or consumer technology company.

  • Strong background in A/B testing, experimentation, and growth-focused engineering.

  • Experience managing and scaling teams, with a passion for mentorship and career development.

  • Ability to balance strategic leadership with hands-on problem-solving.

  • High sense of urgency, customer focus, and collaborative mindset.

Full-Time US Employee Benefits Include

  • Some of the nicest and smartest teammates you’ll ever work with

  • Competitive salaries

  • Comprehensive healthcare benefits

  • Equity in a hypergrowth startup

  • Flexible PTO

  • 401k

  • Parental Leave

  • Commuter Benefits (SF office employees)

  • WFH Stipend

Bay Area Salary Comp Range

$180k-$250k + Equity + Benefits

At Scribe, we celebrate our differences and are committed to creating a workplace where all employees feel supported and empowered to do their best work. We believe this benefits not only our employees but our product, customers, and community as well. Scribe is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

  • Rapid learning machine

About this role

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Backend to join our Documents Team, which powers some of the most essential experiences at Scribe: document viewing and editing, embedding and exporting content, and supporting key integrations. Millions of users rely on these workflows every day.

In this role, you’ll take ownership of impactful projects — from evolving critical document features to building new greenfield systems — and collaborate across the stack to deliver high-quality product experiences. As a backend engineer, you’ll bring depth to our systems, influence technical discussions, and help raise the bar for engineering excellence within the team.

What you’ll do

  • Build and ship backend features in our Django monolith, spanning core document workflows (viewing, editing, embeds, exports) as well as new greenfield projects that expand what Scribe can do

  • Improve performance and reliability by optimizing database queries, endpoints, and caching layers across critical user workflows

  • Collaborate with product managers, designers, and frontend engineers to deliver intuitive and reliable experiences at scale

  • Contribute to technical discussions within the team, balancing short-term delivery with longer-term architectural evolution

  • Uphold strong engineering practices through thoughtful code reviews, solid test coverage, and attention to observability and performance

What we’re looking for

  • You have 5+ years of experience building backend applications at high scale and availability

  • You have extensive experience with Python

  • You know how to optimize endpoint performance and database queries

  • You’re a strong advocate for automated testing

  • You’ve seen and can implement engineering best practices

  • You’re user-centric, empathetic, and passionate about your work

Bonus

  • Experience with Django (not required, but a big plus)

  • Startup experience (not required, but we build and move fast!)

Our backend tech stack

  • Python + Django

  • PostgreSQL

  • Redis

  • Celery + AmazonMQ

  • Infrastructure in Terraform (AWS)

Full-Time US Employee Benefits Include

  • Some of the nicest and smartest teammates you’ll ever work with

  • Competitive salaries

  • Comprehensive healthcare benefits

  • Equity in a hyper growth startup

  • Flexible PTO

  • 401k

  • Parental Leave

  • Commuter Benefits (SF office employees)

  • WFH Stipend

$175,000 - $200,000 base + Equity + Benefits.

We consider several factors when determining compensation, including location, experience, and other job-related factors.

At Scribe, we celebrate our differences and are committed to creating a workplace where all employees feel supported and empowered to do their best work. We believe this benefits not only our employees but our product, customers, and community as well. Scribe is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

jobs.title: Account Executive, Enterprise
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hiring Manager: Marcus Rider – Sales Manager

✨ TL;DR – Why This Role Matters

We’re looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to help bring Scribe into the world’s most forward-thinking organizations. This role is focused on landing new logos, opening the door for long-term success by securing the first deal within strategic target accounts. You’ll own high-impact sales cycles end to end, helping leaders across industries see how Scribe can transform how their teams get work done. Success in this role means unlocking new enterprise relationships that fuel Scribe’s next chapter of growth.

📌 About the Role

At Scribe, we’re creating a category-defining platform that changes how knowledge flows inside organizations. Our Enterprise AEs are responsible for landing Scribe's largest net-new enterprise customers and setting the foundation for expansion across lines of business.

As an Account Executive, Enterprise at Scribe, you will:

  • Report to Marcus Rider, Sales Manager, and work closely with peers across Sales, Customer Success, Marketing, and Product.

  • Manage a high volume of inbound leads while actively prospecting into a defined set of named enterprise accounts.

  • Focus on net-new sales, landing the first contract within key accounts through thoughtful discovery and value-driven conversations.

  • Run multi-threaded enterprise sales cycles from first meeting to close, typically within a 3–4 month window and $50K–$100K ACV range.

  • Deliver tailored product demos, executive presentations, and proof-of-concepts that clearly tie Scribe’s Workflow AI platform to customer outcomes.

  • Leverage tools like Salesforce, Gong, and Sigma to manage pipeline, improve forecast accuracy, and share insights with GTM leadership.

  • Contribute to evolving our sales motion by identifying what’s working, what’s not, and where we can raise the bar.

🔍 Check out this blog from Holly Anfinson, one of our Enterprise AEs, about what it’s like on the sales team here at Scribe.

🌎 Location

While we’re a globally distributed team, this role requires you to live permanently in the United States.

🧩 What Makes You a Great Fit

You’ll thrive in this role if:

  • You’ve led net-new, multi-stakeholder sales cycles in the enterprise, and know how to turn cold accounts into happy customers.

  • You take a structured approach to selling, with experience using methodologies like MEDDPIC or SPICED to drive predictability.

  • You’re energized by balancing inbound velocity with outbound precision, and can prioritize without dropping the ball.

  • You value clarity, responsiveness, and rigor in how you manage your pipeline and forecast your number.

  • You’re curious about how things work, and you love helping customers connect the dots between problems and solutions.

  • You’re collaborative, coachable, and care deeply about being a great teammate while raising the bar for the team.

If you’re reading this thinking “that’s me,” we’d love to meet you.

🚫 This Role Is Not for You If

  • You’re looking for an established sales playbook, we’re building as we go.

  • You prefer selling into existing customers over net-new acquisition.

  • You avoid ambiguity or expect every deal to follow a predictable path.

  • You hesitate to dive into the weeds of your own pipeline or own your number fully.

👋 About Us

Scribe is where exceptional people come to do the best work of their careers. More than 94% of the Fortune 500 use Scribe to ensure work gets done right. Our Workflow AI platform automatically documents and optimizes workflows so teams work smarter, faster, and more consistently.

We’re growing fast — since our founding in 2019, we’ve grown to over 5 million users across 600,000 businesses. Based in San Francisco, we've raised $55M in funding from top-tier investors and are honored to have been named as a Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup and LinkedIn Top Startup. Join us in our mission to uplevel how people do work.

🛠️ How We Work

We are builders aspiring to master our crafts. We care deeply about our teammates and want to win, together. We fully embrace the following values:

  • Accelerate impact

  • Raise the bar

  • Make our users heroes

  • Clear is kind

  • Rapid learning machine

  • One team one dream

💰 Compensation

$250,000 OTE (50/50 split) + equity + benefits

🎁 Full-Time US Employee Benefits Include

  • Incredible teammates: Work alongside some of the nicest and smartest people you’ll ever meet.

  • Ownership mindset: We’re all owners here, literally. Employees receive equity in Scribe, sharing in the company’s long-term success.

  • Comprehensive coverage: We offer health, dental, and vision insurance for you and your dependents.

  • Time to recharge: Flexible paid time off, plus company holidays to rest and reset.

  • Retirement planning: Employees can contribute to a 401(k) plan to help plan for their future.

  • Support for growing families: Paid parental leave to help you care for and bond with your growing family.

  • Using our powerful data insights to drive your decision-making and design tradeoffs.

  • Partnering closely with engineers to make your designs come to life and iterating collaboratively to address technical constraints.

  • Mentoring and collaborating closely with your design peers to receive and provide feedback to raise the bar on everything we build.

  • Leveraging and contributing to our design system, Stylus, to ensure consistency and efficiency across our product.

You’d be a great fit for this role, if you:

As Accounting Manager at Scribe, you’ll work closely with our Finance and cross-functional teams. You’ll help lead our month-end close, strengthen internal controls, and provide insights that help guide business decisions. Success in this role looks like accurate, reliable reporting; streamlined processes; and proactive problem-solving that positions Accounting as a true business partner.

In your first 3–12 months, you will:

  • Lead monthly and quarterly close processes, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.

  • Own preparation and review of journal entries, account reconciliations, financial statements, and various financial analyses.

  • Manage various matters of revenue accounting, including, but not limited to, revenue recognition, processing costs, customer receivable reconciliation, and deferred revenue.

  • Partner with data, engineering, and product teams to automate reporting and streamline accounting processes.

  • Drive automation and process improvements in our ERP and reporting workflows.

  • Develop and document accounting policies and internal controls to support scale and audit readiness.

  • Support external audits and tax compliance requirements, ensuring Scribe meets all reporting standards.

  • Support accounts payable process, including approving of vendor bills and timely payments.

  • Partner with FP&A to provide budget-to-actual reporting and insights that inform business strategy.

This role is open to remote candidates across the United States. For those based near San Francisco, our team works in-office 3 days per week.

Every member of the team is empowered to experiment across the entire product – from acquisition to onboarding, collaboration to pricing and packaging, expansion and referrals, and more. We set ambitious growth goals, ship multiple experiments each week, and iterate quickly as data comes in. Everyone is comfortable forming data-driven hypotheses, making decisions from results, and moving with urgency. We work cross-functionally with every team in the company to turn insights into shipped product fast.

As a Senior Growth Engineer, you’ll own critical experiments end-to-end: ideation and hypothesis, scoping with Product and Design, building and shipping, measuring impact, and scaling winners with iterative improvements.

You could be a great fit if:

  • You have 5+ years of software engineering experience, ideally across both frontend and backend (startup experience preferred)

  • You thrive in the Build–Measure–Learn loop: designing, running, and analyzing experiments at high velocity

  • You enjoy diving into the data to make hypotheses and inform product decisions

  • You are user-obsessed: empathetic, curious, and motivated to solve real problems for real people

  • You’re curious and constantly playing around with tools and products to draw inspiration from

  • You are comfortable working with our tech stack: Django, React (Next.js/Typescript), Mixpanel, and Cursor.

Bonus

  • You have 2+ years of experience working on a product growth team

  • Experience building lead generation pipelines

  • Experience working in Martech

✨TL;DR - Why This Role Matters

Are you a commercially minded builder with a track record of helping enterprises adopt new technology? We're hiring a Principal Business Development Executive to lead the growth of Scribe Optimize, our newest AI solution designed to help enterprises capture, optimize, and scale how work gets done across their orgs.

This isn’t a role where you step into an existing playbook. You’ll be responsible for introducing Optimize to the market, convincing senior executives to run their first pilots, and turning those pilots into long-term deployments. With Scribe’s existing reach, 5M+ users and 75,000 paying businesses, including half of the Fortune 500, you’ll have a rare platform to make early wins with some of the world’s largest companies.

You’ll report directly to our CRO and partner closely with our CEO and CTO. Together, you’ll shape how Optimize is positioned, sold, and expanded into a durable revenue stream for Scribe.

📌 About the Role

As a Principal AI Business Development Executive at Scribe, you will:

  • Prospect into Fortune 1000 CIOs, Chief AI Officers, and senior executives to secure early pilots of Optimize and expand them into long-term deployments.

  • Build and manage a pipeline of high-value opportunities (average deal size $250K+) and track progress against the core metrics for this role: live pilots, pipeline creation, and revenue.

  • Partner with Product, Solutions, Engineering, and R&D to ensure pilots deliver measurable business outcomes and to influence the roadmap based on customer feedback.

  • Establish reference accounts and customer stories that validate Optimize’s impact and open doors with new customers.

  • Maintain a strong understanding of the AI optimization market and competitive landscape to guide executive conversations and positioning.

  • Codify early wins into repeatable go-to-market playbooks in collaboration with Marketing, Product, and Sales so Optimize can scale beyond first deals.

  • Participate in strategic planning with executive leadership (CRO, CEO, CTO) on market expansion opportunities.

🌎 Location

Based out of our HQ in beautiful San Francisco, California, where are we in office 3X weekly.

  • 10+ years in enterprise business development, technical sales, or strategic partnerships.

  • A track record of selling emerging technology to executives at Fortune 1000 companies, not just running a playbook, but creating the case for adoption.

  • Experience in fast-scaling environments (startup or enterprise) where priorities shift quickly and building structure is part of the job.

  • Familiarity with enterprise AI adoption, you understand the trends, what executives are trying to achieve, and the challenges they face.

  • Strong technical and business fluency, able to connect AI concepts, performance metrics, and optimization strategies to tangible outcomes for customers.

  • Exceptional communication skills with a proven ability to influence and build trust with senior executives.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
tl;dr - Our small but mighty PM team at Scribe is looking for our newest teammate to own one of our most ambitious company goals – driving up Scribe creations with new users. We’re looking for someone with a strong bias for action who would help up-level the Product function with learnings from prior experience. Check out this post from one of our fearless product managers on what it's like to build Product at Scribe 🚀

About this role

In this role, you will work with a talented team of 7 engineers led by the amazing Nick Rosen as your Engineering counterpart, and you will be responsible for:

  • Driving company-level goals and closely tracking relevant business metrics to validate/invalidate our roadmap.

  • Developing a vision for your product area and continuously iterating on it with input from customers, the revenue team, and the market.

  • Partnering closely with Engineering and Design to drive every project from ideation to launch in a way that pushes the quality bar for the product.

  • Being the face of Scribe. Whether it’s presenting the product vision to the C-suite or responding to feature requests in our Scribe Community Slack, our PM team engages with users daily to keep a pulse on the product.

  • Measuring the impact of every release and using data-powered insights to inform and improve our future bets. Please leave the ‘feature factory’ mindset at the door.

Note: This role requires you to be in the SF office 3 days/week. 

You could be a great fit if this sounds like you:

  • Extremely curious and love chasing the “why, why, why” to deeply understand user issues and obsess over creative ways to solve them.

  • 8+ years of building SaaS products for Enterprise customers (startup experience preferred), with experience building for different clients (Chrome extensions, Windows/Mac apps)

  • Appreciate the craft of building products. You can quickly build credibility with your design and engineering counterparts through a deep understanding of and respect for their disciplines.

  • Care about the details. You pride yourself on delivering the best end-to-end user experience and would never say “that’s not my job” or “that’s not my problem”.

  • Deeply understand the customer. You become the go-to person for your product area and can talk someone’s ear off for hours when approached about business and user questions.

  • Outcomes over output. You thrive on owning a company-level OKR and driving towards impact rather than just following processes and frameworks.

  • Highly collaborative. You recognize that your team only amplifies your impact, so you’re excited to inspire and uplevel your team.

  • Think big and deliver incrementally. You love dreaming of “big ideas,” but balance that with incrementally shipping value to our users at a high velocity.

  • Have a strong POV. You can discern good products from great, and stakeholders rely on you to represent the customer and market.

  • Thrive in autonomy. You enjoy shaping the product, not just shipping it. You identify the problems, define the roadmap, and defend your decisions with calculated trade-offs.

About us

Scribe is where exceptional people come to do the best work of their careers. More than 94% of the Fortune 500 use Scribe to ensure work gets done right. Our Workflow AI platform automatically documents and optimizes workflows so teams work smarter, faster, and more consistently.

We’re growing fast — since our founding in 2019, we’ve grown to over 5 million users across 600,000 businesses. Based in San Francisco, we've raised $55M in funding from top-tier investors and are honored to have been named as a Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup and LinkedIn Top Startup. Join us in our mission to uplevel how people do work.

How we work

We are builders aspiring to master our crafts. We care deeply about our teammates and want to win, together. We embrace the following values:

  • Accelerate impact

  • Raise the bar

  • Make our users heroes

  • Clear is kind

  • Rapid learning machine

  • One team, one dream

Full-Time US Employee Benefits Include

  • Some of the nicest and smartest teammates you’ll ever work with

  • Competitive salaries

  • Comprehensive healthcare benefits

  • Equity in a hypergrowth startup

  • Flexible PTO

  • 401k

  • Parental Leave

  • Commuter Benefits (SF office employees)

  • WFH Stipend

Compensation

$180,000 - $220,000 base + Equity + Benefits

At Scribe, we celebrate our differences and are committed to creating a workplace where all employees feel supported and empowered to do their best work. We believe this benefits not only our employees but our product, customers, and community as well. Scribe is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.
